free_text.Form of examination: Written examen at the end of the semester
free_text.Content: [b]Mixtures of gases and condensible substances (complements)[/b][br/][b]Exergy analysis :[/b] caracterisation  of exergy terms including exergy losses of dissipation and devalorisation, first and second Law efficiencies.[br/][br/][b]Combustion :[/b] elements of chemical kinetics, thermal properties of combustion gases, combustion phenomena, energy and exergy analyses of energy systems including combustion (combustion chambers, boilers and fuel cells).[br/][br/][br/][b]Generalisation of the cycle theory :[/b] (engine and compression heat pump cycles, improvements of basic Rankine and Brayton cycles, etc.)[br/]
free_text.Learning outcomes: [b]Domain skills:[/b][br/][li]Master the concepts of mass, energy, and momentum balance, E1[br/][li]Compute the thermodynamic properties of a fluid, E2...[br/][li]Compute the main thermodynamic processes of compressible and incompressible fluids, E4[br/][li]Understand the main thermodynamic cycles, E5[br/][li]Master the concepts of thermodynamic efficiency, E6[br/][li]Know the principles and limitations of the main energy conversion technologies, E7[br/][b]Transversal skills:[/b][br/][li]Estimate the accuracy level of a process, T18[br/][li]Differentiate between ideal and feasible, T19[br/][li]Work ethically respecting safety and the environment, T21[br/][li]Analyse the consequences of a decision or solution, T20[br/]
